Sure, here's my feedback:

Overall, your text describes a beautiful landscape with vivid colors, a picturesque sky, and various elements such as mountains, water, and trees. However, there are a few things that could be improved to make your text more engaging and descriptive.

First, instead of using the word "handsome" to describe the colors, you could use more descriptive adjectives such as "vibrant", "rich", or "breathtaking". This would help paint a clearer picture of the landscape in the reader's mind.

Second, the word "apic" is not commonly used in English. You could use "majestic", "towering", or "imposing" to describe the mountains instead.

Third, you could add more descriptive details about the man sitting on the wooden stairs. For example, you could describe his clothing, his expression, or his body language to make the scene more vivid.

Fourth, you could use more descriptive language to paint a clearer picture of the kayaks on the water and the small pier. For example, you could describe the colors and shapes of the kayaks, and the size and shape of the pier.

Finally, instead of saying "there's a lot of trees at the bottom of the mountain", you could use more descriptive language to create a clearer image of the trees, such as "lush green trees", "tall, towering trees", or "a forest of trees".

I hope these suggestions help you improve your text!
